# pinsLabkey

<!-- badges: start -->
[![Lifecycle: experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://lifecycle.r-lib.org/articles/stages.html#experimental)
<!-- badges: end -->

pinsLabkey provides a wrapper around [pins](https://pins.rstudio.com/) to read and write data to LabKey boards

## Installation

You can install the development version of pinsLabkey like so:

``` r
remotes::install_github(repo = "camorosi/pinsLabkey")
```
